channel.title: Grmblog
channel.description: Writing things down so I remember

item.title: Learn You A Kee-Frame, Part 5
item.description: It was my pork chop. But that's ok. I ate his dog food.-- Bam Bam BigelowThe program is not finished, but this part is when it becomes useful. I just used it in a training session for the first time. Haha! Hahaha!

item.title: Learn You A Kee-Frame, Part 4
item.description: Originally I just wanted to take a look at re-frame/kee-frame. But I've been thinking about a program aware training log that runs on my phone for a while now. So I had been thinking about React Native and that possibility was in the back of my mind.I was not really aware of "Progressive Web Apps", I only had a vague notion that webapps these days can run offline too. But I did read up on it and figured this might be a viable option. And I would not have to deal with app stores.

item.title: Learn You A Kee-Frame, Part 3
item.description: A wizard's staff has a knob on the end.-- TraditionalIt is time to write a more substantial example. We are going to write a lifter's log, with records (haha!) of weights lifted and fancy charts. By pure chance I already have such a thing and I love it, except for 2 deficiencies: data entry sucks and it does not run on my phone.

item.title: Learn You A Kee-Frame, Part 2
item.description: Let's talk about The Elm Architecture for a bit. You need 3 things:

item.title: Learn You A Kee-Frame, Part 1
item.description: I am taking a look at kee-frame. This also implies re-frame - I've read about it, there seemed to be a lot of boilerplate, but I've never used it.But I continue to hear good things about it, so here we are.

item.title: Clojure Tools and Deps
item.description: I used to write a lot of clojure, but I have not for some years. In particular, I am pretty used to leiningen, but deps.edn is all new to me. The information here is mostly from deps_and_cli_guide and deps_and_cli_refCommand line switches
